column1: 13175806-CF1D-4B0C-A2A2-ECE3C66EE78A#appfire#D99F3476-A373-495D-90FF-1F3B9643E222#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-01-14 17:40:35#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-01-14 17:40:35#appfire#1

column1: 2AF7DAD4-E371-4773-8B5D-D5A1DB8AF5DA#appfire#D99F3476-A373-495D-90FF-1F3B9643E222#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-01-14 17:40:35#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-01-14 17:40:35#appfire#1
